@YuweiXiao the concurrent-write feature of consistent hashing is work well with MOR table.

So, I will close this issue

> @YuweiXiao the concurrent-write feature of consistent hashing is work well with MOR table.
> 
> So, I will close this issue

Thanks for checking the issue, Eric! I'll add some validation checks when using the consistent hashing.

> > @YuweiXiao the concurrent-write feature of consistent hashing is work well with MOR table.
> > So, I will close this issue
> 
> Thanks for checking the issue, Eric! I'll add some validation checks when using the consistent hashing.

@YuweiXiao Consistent hashing is very useful, thanks for your help!

> > > When we use the multi plan compaction,we may need the plan to commit in order,
> > 
> > 
> > Can you explain what's the problem here if the plan is committed in disorder ?
> 
> In the case the latter plan has committed before the former one, but the job failed before the former one be committed,will that casuse some unexpected problems?

No, the rollback will happen when start writing new instant.

> > > > When we use the multi plan compaction,we may need the plan to commit in order,
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Can you explain what's the problem here if the plan is committed in disorder ?
> > 
> > 
> > In the case the latter plan has committed before the former one, but the job failed before the former one be committed,will that casuse some unexpected problems?
> 
> No, the rollback will happen when start writing new instant.

So if the job fail, all instant will be rollback, right?
@hudi-bot run azure
Thanks all, finally the issue was that cloudera provides the configuration for the parameter hbase.defaults.for.version.skip. After overwriting the parameter within cloudera manager it works.
This pr solve the ClassNotFoundException of MulticastListener.

For the ConnectionClosedException in https://github.com/apache/hudi/issues/6509, I don't know how to do. 
This page  https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-hudi-considerations.html provides a way to work around.
This page  https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-hudi-considerations.html provides a way to work around, but the problem in spark bundle still exists.

@yihua Thank you for adding the fix to the other versions!
@kazdy `_rt` tables are views created for real-time queries, meant for read only so we're not supposed to run update against it. please run updates to the original hudi table.

@nitinkul @vicuna96 Since primary key and precombine field rarely change, could you try setting these in [hudi-defaults.conf](https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations/#externalized-config-file) and retry?
Closing as patch is available and should be released in 0.12.1.
cool man. @codope thanks.

CI is green
![Screen Shot 2022-09-19 at 7 47 11 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/513218/191045839-4409d5a4-1ec5-4f31-8ce3-3c6921825d31.png)
yes, if there are multiple writers writing concurrently to same hudi table, locks are mandatory. if not, you could find data loss or data duplication and other failures.

will go ahead and close the issue for now. but you can feel free to open a new issue once you have some updates. let me know if you are ok with it. Or if you wish to have the issue open, I am good too.
@santoshraj123 : any updates please.
@ankitchandnani : any update please.
@rjmblc : do you have any updates on this please.
Testing it out today, will provide an update by EOD

@Shubham21k you're adding column `ten` of type `boolean` and yet the default value (`ten_10`) is string. Is this expected?

Also, compared to similiar column `six`, looks like the schema registry does not add null default for `ten`. 
For `six`, this is what schema registry reports:
```
{\"name\":\"six\",\"type\":[{\"type\":\"string\",\"connect.default\":\"sfa\"},\"null\"],\"default\":\"sfa\"}
```
For `ten`, it looks like:
```
{\"name\":\"ten\",\"type\":{\"type\":\"string\",\"connect.default\":\"ten_10\"},\"default\":\"ten_10\"}
```
Note the difference in `type` union. In case of `six`, it allows null.

@jiangbiao910 : can you respond to above request please.

nope. thats not how it works as of today. 2nd writer don't wait for 1st writer to complete. Thats not OCC at all in my understanding. what you are suggesting is, take a global lock for each write, complete the write and  release the lock and then start w/ next write. In my opinion, this is just a sequential batch of writes. 

In general sense, multi-writer means, two concurrent writers can write to hudi concurrently. if they don't overlap wrt data they update, both should succeed. if not, one of them will fail. 

let me know if you need more clarification.

> The validation is legitimate, i.e. for a completed instant the marker dir is removed, so rollback cannot be done based on markers. Just to go past this issue, you can disable `hoodie.rollback.using.markers` (https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations#hoodierollbackusingmarkers). To fix this properly, I would suggest that Hudi either falls back to `ListingBasedRollbackStrategy` in such cases, or fails fast (at the time of scheduling rollback itself so that users can disable rollback using markers before rollback plan is written). @yihua wdyt?

 Does disabling 'hoodie.rollback.using.markers' make rollback inefficient?
